snippet: The struggle to develop a coherent response intensified as new calls for a blocwide plan were met with recriminations about the Continent being swamped with Muslims.
abstract: Weak and divided response from European leaders to mounting migrant crisis continues, with hundreds of thousands of desperate people pouring into Continent from Africa and Middle East only to find overwhelming chaos at borders; many migrants are struggling to avoid being herded into overcrowded processing camps in Hungary and elsewhere; German Chancellor Angela Merkel continues to press European Union leaders for system of quotas and rules that will have each country preparing to accept fair share of migrants over their borders.

byline.original: By STEVEN ERLANGER and DAN BILEFSKY
byline.contributor: Steven Erlanger and Dan Bilefsky reported from London. Reporting was contributed by Palko Karasz from Budapest and Bicske, Hungary; Anemona Hartocollis from Budapest; Alison Smale from Vienna; Melissa Eddy from Berlin; and James Kanter from Brussels.

lead_paragraph: The struggle to develop a coherent response intensified as new calls for a blocwide plan were met with recriminations about the Continent being swamped with Muslims.

headline.main: Migrant Chaos Mounts While Divided Europe Stumbles for Response
headline.print_headline: Migrant Chaos Mounts While Divided Europe Stumbles for Response

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
